translated: When they go to the realm of hell beings, they are free from all the dust of afflictions. When they go to the animal realm, they are free from the darkness of stupidity.

translated: Even when they go to the world of the Lord of Death, they take with them all the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / gzugs med pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang de'i 'gro ba la yang dag par 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: Even when they go to the realms of the gods of the desire realm, the gods of the form realm, and the gods of the formless realm, they do not engage in the activities of those realms.

original: can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa yin /
analyzed: can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa yin /
translated: Even when they go to the realm of anger, they are free from anger toward all sentient beings.

analyzed: gti mug gi 'gro bar 'gro'ang chos thams cad la shes rab kyis nges par rtogs pa'i sems pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Even when they go to the realm of delusion, they are endowed with the wisdom that fully realizes all phenomena.

original: ser sna'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang lus dang / srog la mi lta bas phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba yin /
analyzed: ser sna'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang lus dang / srog la mi lta bas phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba yin /
translated: Even when they go to the realm of stinginess, they give away all their outer and inner possessions without regard for their bodies or lives.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang kha na ma tho ba cung zad la'ang 'jigs par lta zhing sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang kha na ma tho ba cung zad la'ang 'jigs par lta zhing sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad la gnas pa yin /
translated: They go to places where people have broken their ethics, but they are careful about even the smallest wrongdoing and they live by all the ascetic practices and austerities.

original: gnod sems kyi tha ba dang / khong khro ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang shin tu gnod sems med cing byams pa la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi tha ba dang / khong khro ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang shin tu gnod sems med cing byams pa la gnas pa yin /
translated: They go to places where people have the callousness of malice and the behavior of anger, but they are very compassionate and live by love.

original: le lo'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang brtson 'grus rtsom pa rgyun mi 'chad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa yin /
analyzed: le lo'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang brtson 'grus rtsom pa rgyun mi 'chad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa yin /
translated: They go to places where people are lazy, but they are constantly energetic and they strive to seek out all the roots of virtue.

original: dbang po 'khrul ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs shing bsam gtan don yod pa yin /
analyzed: dbang po 'khrul ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs shing bsam gtan don yod pa yin /
translated: They go to places where people have confused senses, but they are naturally absorbed and their meditation is meaningful.

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'gro bar song zhing 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'gro bar song zhing 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa yin /
translated: They go to places where people have faulty wisdom, but they have the wisdom that comes from going to the perfection of wisdom and they are skilled in all the mundane and supramundane treatises.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag byed pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang ldem po dag la mkhas shing thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa tshar phyin pa'ang yin /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag byed pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang ldem po dag la mkhas shing thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa tshar phyin pa'ang yin /
translated: They may go among those who are hypocritical and pretentious, but they are skilled in the use of indirect speech and are experts in the practice of skillful means.

original: nga rgyal gyi 'gro ba'ang ston la 'jig rten thams @334b cad kyi zam pa dang / stegs bur 'gyur ba'ang yin /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi 'gro ba'ang ston la 'jig rten thams @334b cad kyi zam pa dang / stegs bur 'gyur ba'ang yin /
translated: They may show themselves to be going among those who are proud, but they are bridges and stepping-stones for all worlds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang shin tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'ang yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang shin tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'ang yin /
translated: They may go among those who are afflicted, but they are completely unafflicted and naturally pure.

original: bdud kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'ang yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'ang yin /
translated: They may go among the māras, but they are not led astray by any of the māras.

original: nyan thos kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sems can rnams la ma thos pa'i chos thos par byed pa'ang yin; rang sangs rgyas kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po las byung ba'ang yin /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sems can rnams la ma thos pa'i chos thos par byed pa'ang yin; rang sangs rgyas kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po las byung ba'ang yin /
translated: They may go among the śrāvakas, but they cause beings to hear the Dharma that they have not heard. They may go among the pratyekabuddhas, but they are born from great compassion in order to ripen all beings.

original: dbul po'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang longs spyod zad mi shes pa'i rin po che lag na thogs pa'ang yin /
analyzed: dbul po'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang longs spyod zad mi shes pa'i rin po che lag na thogs pa'ang yin /
translated: They go to the realms of the poor, yet they hold in their hands inexhaustible jewels.

original: dbang po nyams pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang gzugs bzang zhing mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'ang yin /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang gzugs bzang zhing mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'ang yin /
translated: They go to the realms of the disabled, yet they have excellent bodies, well adorned with the major and minor marks of buddhahood.

original: rigs ngan par skye ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba'ang yin /
analyzed: rigs ngan par skye ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba'ang yin /
translated: They go to the realms of those born in the lower species, yet they are born in the lineage of the Tathagata, having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: nyam chung zhing mdog ngan pa gzhan pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang blta na sdug pa dang / sred med kyi bu'i lus lta bu thob pa'ang yin /
analyzed: nyam chung zhing mdog ngan pa gzhan pa'i 'gro bar 'gro'ang blta na sdug pa dang / sred med kyi bu'i lus lta bu thob pa'ang yin /
translated: They go to the realms of others who are weak and ugly, yet they obtain a body that is beautiful to behold, like that of Narayana.

original: sems can thams cad lan ba dang / mi bde ba'i spyod pa'ang ston la 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las shin tu 'das shing rab tu choms pa'ang yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad lan ba dang / mi bde ba'i spyod pa'ang ston la 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las shin tu 'das shing rab tu choms pa'ang yin /
translated: They show all beings the behavior of the sick and the unhappy, yet they are completely victorious over the fear of death.

original: longs spyod kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang btsal ba thams cad med cing mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la so sor rtog pa mang ba'ang yin /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'gro bar 'gro'ang btsal ba thams cad med cing mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la so sor rtog pa mang ba'ang yin /

translated: Not accepting is not observing. Not observing is not conceptualizing or eliminating. Not conceptualizing or eliminating all phenomena is entering into nonduality.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' mig bzang gis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mig bzang gis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Sunetra said,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis so //
translated: “One characteristic and no characteristic are two.

original: gang rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: gang rtog par mi byed /
translated: One who does not conceptualize

original: kun tu rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: kun tu rtog par mi byed /
translated: does not conceptualize.🔽One who does not conceptualize

original: mtshan nyid gcig par mi byed /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig par mi byed /
translated: does not conceptualize one characteristic.🔽One who does not conceptualize

original: mtshan nyid med par mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mi byed do //
translated: does not conceptualize no characteristic.

original: gang mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba la mtshan nyid mtshungs par 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba la mtshan nyid mtshungs par 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The non-dual is the non-differentiation of the characteristics of the characteristics of the different.

original: byang chub sems dpa' skar rgyal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skar rgyal gyis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Tiṣya declared,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba de ni gnyis @340b te; gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba mi slong zhing mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnyis su med par rtog pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba de ni gnyis @340b te; gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba mi slong zhing mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnyis su med par rtog pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: “‘Virtuous’ and ‘non-virtuous’ are dualistic. The non-dual is the non-differentiation of the virtuous and the non-virtuous, the signless and the signless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' seng ges smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' seng ges smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Siṃha declared,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘Reprehensible’ and ‘non-reprehensible’ are dualistic.

original: gang gis rdo rje ltar rab tu 'bigs pa'i ye shes kyis mi 'ching mi grol ba de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rdo rje ltar rab tu 'bigs pa'i ye shes kyis mi 'ching mi grol ba de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The non-dual is the non-differentiation of the reprehensible and the non-reprehensible, the unattached and the unfettered.

original: byang chub sems dpa' seng ge blo gros kyis smras pa /🔽'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' seng ge blo gros kyis smras pa /🔽'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Siṃhamati declared,🔽“‘Defiled’ and ‘undefiled’ are dualistic.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “This is contaminated” and “This is uncontaminated” is dualistic.

original: gang mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thob pas zag pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes su mi byed /
analyzed: gang mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thob pas zag pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes su mi byed /
translated: Those who attain the equality of phenomena do not conceive of contamination or noncontamination.

original: 'du shes med par gyur pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes med par gyur pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not in a state of nonconceptuality.

original: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid thob pa'ang med cing 'du shes kyi mdud pa med pa de ltar gang 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid thob pa'ang med cing 'du shes kyi mdud pa med pa de ltar gang 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: They have attained the equality of equality, and they are free from the knots of conceptualization. To engage in that way is to engage in the nondual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bde mos kyis smras pa /🔽'di ni bde ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bde mos kyis smras pa / 'di ni bde ba /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Sukhādhimukta said,

original: 'di ni mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘This is happiness’ and ‘This is suffering’ is dualistic.

original: gang ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir grangs thams cad dang bral zhing blo nam mkha' dang mtshungs par mi chags pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir grangs thams cad dang bral zhing blo nam mkha' dang mtshungs par mi chags pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who are free from all enumeration and whose minds are as unattached as space due to the purity of wisdom engage in the nondual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sred med kyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sred med kyis smras pa /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Nārāyaṇa said,

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: “‘This is worldly’ and ‘This is supramundane’ is dualistic.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ‘This is supramundane’ is dualistic.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin stong pa de la cung zad kyang rgal ba'ang med /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin stong pa de la cung zad kyang rgal ba'ang med /
translated: The nature of the world is emptiness. There is nothing to transcend,

original: 'jug pa'ang med /🔽'gro @341a *// ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'jug pa'ang med / 'gro @341a *// ba'ang med /
translated: nothing to enter,🔽nothing to go,

original: mi 'gro ba'ang med de /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba'ang med de /
translated: and nothing to not go.

original: gang la mi rgal /
analyzed: gang la mi rgal /
translated: There is nothing to transcend,

original: mi 'jug / 'gro ba'ang med /
analyzed: mi 'jug / 'gro ba'ang med /
translated: nothing to enter, nothing to go,🔽and nothing to not go.

original: mi 'gro ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba'i blo gros kyis smras pa /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba'i blo gros kyis smras pa /
translated: This is the entrance into nonduality.

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Vinītadeva declared, “‘Saṃsāra’ and ‘nirvāṇa’ are dualistic.

original: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid mthong bas mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid mthong bas mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: When the nature of saṃsāra is seen, there is neither saṃsāra nor nirvāṇa.

original: gang de ltar rtogs pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum mthong gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang de ltar rtogs pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum mthong gis smras pa /
translated: To realize this is to enter into nonduality.🔽” The bodhisattva Pratyakṣadarśa declared, “‘Extinction’ and ‘non-extinction’ are dualistic.

original: zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis so; ;zad pa ni shin tu zad pa ste /
analyzed: zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis so; ;zad pa ni shin tu zad pa ste /
translated: Extinction is utterly extinguished.

original: gang shin tu zad pa de la zad par bya ba ma yin pas na de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang shin tu zad pa de la zad par bya ba ma yin pas na de'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is utterly exhausted is not to be exhausted. Therefore, it is called ‘inexhaustible.’

original: gang mi zad pa de ni skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang mi zad pa de ni skad cig pa ste /
translated: That which is inexhaustible is momentary.

original: skad cig pa la zad pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa la zad pa med do //
translated: In a moment, there is no exhaustion.

original: de lta bur rab tu zhugs pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur rab tu zhugs pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who engages in this way is said to have entered the gate of the nondual Dharma.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas sbas kyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas sbas kyis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Samādhi­ratna­śrī said,

original: bdag dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘Self’ and ‘selflessness’ are dualistic.

original: gang bdag gi dngos po mi dmigs pa de ci zhig bdag med par byed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid mthong bas gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gi dngos po mi dmigs pa de ci zhig bdag med par byed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid mthong bas gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since the nature of that which is not observed as a self is not something that can be made selfless, seeing their nature is nondual. Therefore, it is called ‘entering nonduality.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' glog gi lhas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' glog gi lhas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vidyuddeva said,

original: rig pa dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rig pa dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘Knowledge’ and ‘ignorance’ are dualistic.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin ltar rig pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin ltar rig pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: Knowledge is just like the nature of ignorance.

original: ma rig @341b ba gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa /
analyzed: ma rig @341b ba gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa /
translated: Ignorance is neutral,

original: bgrang du med pa /
analyzed: bgrang du med pa /
translated: not to be counted,

original: bgrang ba'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: beyond the path of counting.

original: gang 'di la mngon par rtogs pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' mthong dags smras pa /
analyzed: gang 'di la mngon par rtogs pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' mthong dags smras pa /
translated: To realize this is to enter into nonduality.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa ste /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Priyadarśana declared, “Form is emptiness.

original: gzugs bshig pas stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs bshig pas stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Form is not destroyed, and so is not empty.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa ste /
translated: The nature of form is emptiness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par sangs  pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par sangs  pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: Consciousness is emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa bshig pas stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bshig pas stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness is not destroyed, and so is not empty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of consciousness is emptiness.

original: 'di la gang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la de bzhin du shes shing de lta bur ye shes kyis rig pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la de bzhin du shes shing de lta bur ye shes kyis rig pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, the one who knows the five appropriated aggregates in this way and who understands them with wisdom in this way enters into nonduality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od kyi tog gis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od kyi tog gis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Prabhāketu declared,

original: khams bzhi po'ang gzhan la nam mkha'i khams kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: khams bzhi po'ang gzhan la nam mkha'i khams kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘The four elements are one thing, and the element of space is another’—that is dualistic.

original: khams bzhi bo ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //🔽sngon gyi mtha' yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //🔽phyi ma'i mtha' yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams bzhi bo ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin no // sngon gyi mtha' yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin no // phyi ma'i mtha' yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The four elements are of the nature of space.🔽The past is of the nature of space.🔽The future is of the nature of space.

original: de bzhin du da ltar yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin te /
translated: And just as it is in the present, so it is in the past and the future.

original: gang de ltar khams la 'jug pa'i ye shes de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar khams la 'jug pa'i ye shes de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that enters into the elements in this way enters into nonduality.🔽”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab kyi blo gros kyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab kyi blo gros kyis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Subhūti declared,

original: mig dang / gzugs so zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs so zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “‘The eye and forms’—this is dualistic.

original: gang mig yongs su shes pas gzugs la mi chags /
analyzed: gang mig yongs su shes pas gzugs la mi chags /
translated: When the eye is fully understood, one does not engage with forms.

original: mi @342a *// sdang  mi rmongs pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi @342a *// sdang  mi rmongs pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is not angry and not deluded is said to be ‘peaceful. ’

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra /🔽sna dang dri /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra / sna dang dri /
translated: In the same way, the ear and sounds,🔽the nose and smells,

original: lce dang ro /
analyzed: lce dang ro /
translated: the tongue and tastes,

original: lus dang reg /
analyzed: lus dang reg /
translated: the body and tangibles,

original: yid dang chos de dag ni gnyis so //
analyzed: yid dang chos de dag ni gnyis so //
translated: and the mind and mental phenomena are dualistic.

original: gang yang yid yongs su shes nas chos la mi chags /
analyzed: gang yang yid yongs su shes nas chos la mi chags /
translated: When the mind is fully understood, one does not become attached to mental phenomena,

original: mi sdang / mi rmongs pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdang / mi rmongs pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is not angry with them, and is not deluded about them. That is said to be ‘peaceful. ’

original: de ltar zhi ba la gnas pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba la gnas pa ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, one who abides in peace enters into nonduality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /🔽sbyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pas smras pa / sbyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattva Akṣayamati declared,🔽“The dedication of generosity to omniscience is dualistic.🔽The essence of generosity is omniscience.

original: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The essence of omniscience is dedication.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are two if wisdom is dedicated to omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Omniscience is the nature of wisdom.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'ang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'ang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Dedication is also the nature of omniscience.

original: gang tshul gcig pa 'di la 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' blo zab kyis smras pa /
analyzed: gang tshul gcig pa 'di la 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' blo zab kyis smras pa /
translated: To enter into this single principle is to enter into nonduality.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'ang gzhan no zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'ang gzhan no zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattva Gambhīrabuddhi declared, “‘Emptiness’ is one thing, ‘signlessness’ is another, and ‘wishlessness’ is still another’—this is dualism.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de la mtshan ma gang yang med do //
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de la mtshan ma gang yang med do //
translated: In emptiness there is no sign at all.

original: mtshan ma med pa la smon pa med /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la smon pa med /
translated: In signlessness there is no wish.

original: smon pa med pa la sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med de /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med de /
translated: In wishlessness there is no mental activity, no mental process, and no consciousness.

original: gang rnam par thar pa gcig @342b gi sgo de la rnam par thar pa thams cad kyi sgo rnams su blta bar bya ba de ni gnyis su med pa'i sgor 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par thar pa gcig @342b gi sgo de la rnam par thar pa thams cad kyi sgo rnams su blta bar bya ba de ni gnyis su med pa'i sgor 'jug pa'o //
translated: The gateway to the single liberation is the gateway to all liberations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po zhi bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po zhi bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Śāntendriya declared,

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: “ ‘Buddha,’ ‘Dharma,’ and ‘Saṅgha’—these are dualistic.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni chos so //
translated: The nature of the Buddha is the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ni dge 'dun te /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ni dge 'dun te /
translated: The nature of the Dharma is the Saṅgha.

original: de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: All of them are unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The unconditioned is space.

original: chos thams cad kyi tshul ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshul ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: The way of all phenomena is the same as space.

original: gang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: To follow in this way is to enter nonduality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thogs pa med pa'i mig gis smras pa /🔽'jig tshogs dang / 'jig tshogs 'gog pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thogs pa med pa'i mig gis smras pa / 'jig tshogs dang / 'jig tshogs 'gog pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Asangagātra declared,

original: 'jig tshogs nyid ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs nyid ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “ ‘The perishing aggregates’ and ‘the cessation of the perishing aggregates’—these are dualistic.🔽The perishing aggregates themselves are cessation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'jig tshogs su lta ba mi skye ba med cing gang lta ba des 'jig tshogs so zhe'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'jig tshogs su lta ba mi skye ba med cing gang lta ba des 'jig tshogs so zhe'am /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig tshogs 'gog ces mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs 'gog ces mi rtog ste /
translated: Because the view of the transitory collection does not arise, and through that view one does not think, ‘The transitory collection is,’ or ‘The cessation of the transitory collection is.’

original: de mi rtog /
analyzed: de mi rtog /
translated: One does not think that,

original: rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog /
translated: does not conceptualize that,🔽and does not fully conceptualize that.

original: shin tu mi rtogs pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur te; mi 'byung mi 'jig pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' shin tu dul bas smras pa /
analyzed: shin tu mi rtogs pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur te; mi 'byung mi 'jig pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' shin tu dul bas smras pa /
translated: Since one does not conceptualize, one becomes the nature of cessation, and that which does not arise and does not disintegrate is the entrance into nonduality.”

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis su med de /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis su med de /
translated: The bodhisattva Su­danta declared, “The so-called restraint of body, speech, and mind is nondual.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos 'di dag ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /🔽lus kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang yin pa ngag gi mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de'i mtshan @343a *//
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid de / lus kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang yin pa ngag gi mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de'i mtshan @343a *//
translated: These phenomena are characterized by non-conditioning.

original: nyid do // yid kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: nyid do // yid kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The non-conditioning of the body is also characterized by the non-conditioning of speech, and the non-conditioning of the mind is also characterized by that.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa de yin par shes par bya /🔽rjes su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi mngon par 'du mi byed pa de yin par shes par bya / rjes su rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known that this is the non-performance of all dharmas.

original: gang 'di la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams zhing gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang 'di la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams zhing gis smras pa /
translated: The knowledge of this non-performance is the entrance into non-duality.

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The Bodhisattva Punyakṣetra declared, “‘Meritorious action, non-meritorious action, and immovable action’—this is dualism.

original: gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du mi byed pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //🔽bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa ste de la bsod nams kyang med /
analyzed: gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du mi byed pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o // bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa ste de la bsod nams kyang med /
translated: The non-performance of meritorious action, non-meritorious action, and immovable action is non-duality.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'ang med /🔽mi g-yo ba'ang med /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'ang med / mi g-yo ba'ang med /
translated: Meritorious action, non-meritorious action, and immovable action are empty of own-marks; in them there is no merit,🔽no demerit,🔽no immovability,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'ang med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'ang med de /
translated: and no performance.

original: gang de ltar mi sgrub pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' padma bkod pas smras pa /
analyzed: gang de ltar mi sgrub pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' padma bkod pas smras pa /
translated: Not to practice in that way is to enter into nonduality.

original: bdag kun nas ldang ba las skyes pa de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag kun nas ldang ba las skyes pa de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Padmavyūha declared, “‘I’ and ‘mine’ are two.

original: bdag yongs su shes pa ni gnyis mi slong ngo //
analyzed: bdag yongs su shes pa ni gnyis mi slong ngo //
translated: When the self is fully understood, the notion of ‘mine’ does not arise.

original: de ltar gnyis su med par gnas pa la rnam par rig pa med pas rnam par rig pa med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med par gnas pa la rnam par rig pa med pas rnam par rig pa med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi snying pos smras pa /
translated: Thus, when one abides in nonduality, there is no consciousness, and the absence of consciousness is the entrance into nonduality.

original: @343b dmigs pas rab tu phye ba de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: @343b dmigs pas rab tu phye ba de ni gnyis so //
translated: ” The bodhisattva Śrīgupta declared, “‘Perceived’ and ‘nonperceived’ are two.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: That which is not perceived is nondual.

original: de'i phyir gang len pa med cing 'dor ba med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i bla mas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang len pa med cing 'dor ba med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i bla mas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, not to grasp and not to reject is to enter into nonduality.

original: mun pa dang / snang ba zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mun pa dang / snang ba zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Candracchattra declared, “‘Darkness’ and ‘light’ are two.

original: mun pa'ang med /
analyzed: mun pa'ang med /
translated: There is no darkness

original: snang ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of light is non-duality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar 'gog par snyoms par zhugs pa la mun pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog par snyoms par zhugs pa la mun pa'ang med /
translated: Because in the absorption of cessation there is no darkness,

original: snang ba'ang med de /
analyzed: snang ba'ang med de /
translated: and there is no light.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The characteristics of all phenomena are like this.

original: gang mnyam pa nyid 'di la 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang mnyam pa nyid 'di la 'jug pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who enter into this sameness enter into non-duality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lag na phyag rgya rin po ches smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lag na phyag rgya rin po ches smras pa /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Ratnamudrāhasta declared, “To delight in nirvāṇa and not to delight in saṃsāra is dualism.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' zhing 'khor ba la mi dga' ba de ni gnyis te /🔽gang mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' zhing 'khor ba la mi dga' ba de ni gnyis te / gang mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa /
translated: To delight in nirvāṇa and not to delight in saṃsāra is dualism.

original: 'khor ba la'ang mi dga' ba med pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la'ang mi dga' ba med pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: To delight in neither nirvāṇa nor saṃsāra is non-duality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang bcings pa las ni grol bar bstan gyi /
analyzed: gang bcings pa las ni grol bar bstan gyi /
translated: It is taught that one is liberated from bondage,

original: gang shin tu ma bcings pa de thar pa ga la tshol /
analyzed: gang shin tu ma bcings pa de thar pa ga la tshol /
translated: but how can one who is not at all bound seek liberation?

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i dge slong gis ni dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba'ang mi rnyed de /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i dge slong gis ni dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba'ang mi rnyed de /
translated: The monk who is neither bound nor liberated does not find anything to be either pleasant or unpleasant.

original: de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' nor bu brtsegs pa'i rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' nor bu brtsegs pa'i rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: This is the entrance into nonduality.

original: lam dang / lam ngan pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lam dang / lam ngan pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Maṇisūtra­rāja declared, “‘Path’ and ‘wrong path’ are dualistic.

original: lam du zhugs pa la ni lam ngan pa mi spyod do //
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa la ni lam ngan pa mi spyod do //
translated: One who has entered the path does not practice a wrong path.

original: mi spyod pa la gnas pa ni lam gyi 'du shes @344a *//
analyzed: mi spyod pa la gnas pa ni lam gyi 'du shes @344a *//
translated: One who does not practice has no notion of a path

original: sam; lam ma yin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sam; lam ma yin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or of a wrong path.

original: 'du shes yongs su rig pa ni blo gnyis su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'du shes yongs su rig pa ni blo gnyis su mi 'jug ste /
translated: One who has understood the notion of a path does not engage in duality.

original: de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' bden dags smras pa /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' bden dags smras pa /
translated: This is the entrance into nonduality.

original: bden pa dang / rdzun pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bden pa dang / rdzun pa zhes bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Satyavādin declared, “‘Truth’ and ‘falsehood’ are dualistic.

original: bden pa mthong bas kyang bden pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na rdzun pa lta ga la mthong /
analyzed: bden pa mthong bas kyang bden pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na rdzun pa lta ga la mthong /
translated: One who sees the truth does not see even truth, let alone falsehood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sha'i mig gis mi mthong gi shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: sha'i mig gis mi mthong gi shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ste /
translated: The fleshly eye does not see, but the eye of wisdom does.

original: ji ltar mi mthong na rnam par mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthong na rnam par mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: How does it see? It sees by not seeing.

original: gang la mthong ba'ang med /
analyzed: gang la mthong ba'ang med /
translated: Where there is no seeing,

original: rnam par mthong ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mthong ba'ang med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: no seeing of particulars, that is the entrance into nonduality.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis rang rang gi bstan pa bshad nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis rang rang gi bstan pa bshad nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: ” When those bodhisattvas had each spoken their own praises, they addressed Mañjuśrīkumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i gnyis su med par 'jug pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i gnyis su med par 'jug pa gang yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is the bodhisattvas’ entrance into nonduality?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: skyes bu dam pa khyed kun gyis kyang legs par smras mod kyi khyed kyis bshad pa de thams cad ni gnyis so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa khyed kun gyis kyang legs par smras mod kyi khyed kyis bshad pa de thams cad ni gnyis so //
translated: “Noble sirs, you have all spoken well, but all that you have said is dualistic.

original: bstan pa gcig ni ma gtogs te brjod du med pa /🔽smrar med pa /🔽bshad du med pa /
analyzed: bstan pa gcig ni ma gtogs te brjod du med pa / smrar med pa / bshad du med pa /
translated: There is only one teaching, which is inexpressible,🔽cannot be spoken,🔽cannot be explained,

original: bsgrag tu med pa /
analyzed: bsgrag tu med pa /
translated: cannot be proclaimed,

original: bstan du med par gdags su med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du med par gdags su med pa de ni gnyis su med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entrance into nonduality.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad @344b ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad @344b ces smras so //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, “We have all given our own teachings, noble sir.

original: kho bo cag gis ni rang rang gi bstan pa bshad zin na rigs kyi bu khyod kyang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa la spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni rang rang gi bstan pa bshad zin na rigs kyi bu khyod kyang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa la spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Now, may you expound to us the teaching of the entrance into the principle of nonduality!”

original: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: Thereupon, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti kept his silence, saying nothing at all.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /🔽legs so // legs so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te / legs so // legs so //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta applauded the Licchavi Vimalakīrti:🔽“Excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Excellent, noble sir!

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyis su med par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyis su med par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: This is indeed the entrance into the principle of nonduality,

original: de la yi ge dang / sgra dang / rnam par rig pa'i rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: de la yi ge dang / sgra dang / rnam par rig pa'i rgyu ba med do //
translated: for here there is no question of letters or of the voice,🔽and yet one teaches nonduality by means of letters and the voice.

original: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor zhugs bas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor zhugs bas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: When this teaching was explained, five thousand bodhisattvas entered the gate of the Dharma of nonduality and attained tolerance of the fact that all things are unborn.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor 'jug pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgor 'jug pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
translated: This concludes “Entering the Gate of Nonduality,” the eighth chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The Flower Ornament Scripture.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di snyam du bsams te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra thought,

original: gdugs tshod la'ang bab na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni mi ldang na 'di dag zan gar za snyam mo //
analyzed: gdugs tshod la'ang bab na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni mi ldang na 'di dag zan gar za snyam mo //
translated: “It is time for the midday meal, but these great bodhisattvas have not yet left their seats. I wonder where they will eat their meal.”

original: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti read the thoughts of the venerable Śāriputra and said to him,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Reverend Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad po gang dag gsungs pa'i rnam par thar pa de dag la gnas par gyis la zang zing dang 'dres pa'i rgyud kyis chos ma nyan cig /🔽btsun pa sh'a @345a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad po gang dag gsungs pa'i rnam par thar pa de dag la gnas par gyis la zang zing dang 'dres pa'i rgyud kyis chos ma nyan cig / btsun pa sh'a @345a *//
translated: You should abide in the eight liberations that the Tathāgata has taught, and you should not listen to the Dharma with a mind that is mixed with material things.

original: ri'i bu / yud tsam zhig sdod cig dang / sngon ma myong ba'i kha zas za bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas de'i tshe li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: ri'i bu / yud tsam zhig sdod cig dang / sngon ma myong ba'i kha zas za bar 'gyur ro // de nas de'i tshe li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, please wait a moment and you will eat such food as you have never before tasted.”

original: 'di 'dra ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byas so //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byas so //
translated: Then at that time the Licchavi Vimalakīrti entered into a concentration, and performed a miraculous feat such that those bhikṣus, the great disciples,🔽and those bodhisattvas, the great beings, and all the other beings in that assembly saw in the northeast, beyond buddhafields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, a universe called Enduring,

original: gang steng gi phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing ganggg'a'i klung bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: gang steng gi phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing ganggg'a'i klung bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog ces bya ba yod de /
translated: and its Tathāgata Enduring,🔽and the Licchavi Vimalakīrti sitting as his attendant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag la bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag la bstan to //
translated: He taught it to those bodhisattvas and to those great śrāvakas.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa zhes bya ba da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes so //
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa zhes bya ba da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes so //
translated: There, the Tathāgata called Gandhottama­kūṭa resides, lives, and is manifest.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams der phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi mi dang / lha'i dri 'byung ba de bas 'jig rten gyi khams de'i shing las ches khyad du 'phags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams der phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi mi dang / lha'i dri 'byung ba de bas 'jig rten gyi khams de'i shing las ches khyad du 'phags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In that world system, the fragrance of the food of the devas and humans of the entire buddhafield of the ten directions spreads.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ming yang med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ming yang med de /
translated: In that world system, the names of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gi tshogs 'dus pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa de chos ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gi tshogs 'dus pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa de chos ston to //
translated: To those assemblies of bodhisattvas, the Tathāgata Gandhottama­kūṭa teaches the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na khang ba brtsegs pa thams cad kyang spos las byas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na khang ba brtsegs pa thams cad kyang spos las byas /
translated: In that world system, all the kūṭāgāras are made of perfume.

original: 'chags dang / skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang thams @345b cad kyang spos las byas so //
analyzed: 'chags dang / skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang thams @345b cad kyang spos las byas so //
translated: all the parks and palaces were made of perfume.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de dag zas za ba'i zas de'i dris 'jig rten gyi khams ched med pa khyab bo //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de dag zas za ba'i zas de'i dris 'jig rten gyi khams ched med pa khyab bo //
translated: The scent of the food eaten by those bodhisattvas spread throughout immeasurable world-realms.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang thabs gcig tu bshos gsol ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang thabs gcig tu bshos gsol ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Gandhottama­kūṭa, together with those bodhisattvas, entered the dining hall for the meal.

original: de na lha'i bu spos bkod ba'i zas zhes bya ba theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur byed par brtson no //
analyzed: de na lha'i bu spos bkod ba'i zas zhes bya ba theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur byed par brtson no //
translated: There, a deva named Gandhahastin, who was practicing the Great Vehicle, was dedicated to serving and venerating the Blessed One and those bodhisattvas.

original: de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des 'jig rten gyi khams de na bcom ldan 'das de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag bshos la bkod de bzhugs pa mthong ngo //

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'khod do; ;de nas sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des zhal zas kyis bkang ba'i snod de dri ma med par grags pa la byin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'khod do; ;de nas sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des zhal zas kyis bkang ba'i snod de dri ma med par grags pa la byin no //
translated: Then the emanated bodhisattva offered the vessel of food to Vimalakīrti,

original: de nas zhal zas de'i dris yangs pa'i grong khyer chen por 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas zhal zas de'i dris yangs pa'i grong khyer chen por 'dug par gyur te /
translated: and the fragrance of that food permeated the entire great city of Vaiśālī.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams stong gi bar du dri zhim po mnam par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams stong gi bar du dri zhim po mnam par gyur to //
translated: The fragrance of that food spread throughout one hundred universes.

original: gang yangs pa'i grong khyer gyi bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams dang / li tsa b'i rnams kyi dbang po li tsa b'i zla gdugs kyis dri de mnams nas ngo mtshar du gyur rmad du gyur te /
analyzed: gang yangs pa'i grong khyer gyi bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams dang / li tsa b'i rnams kyi dbang po li tsa b'i zla gdugs kyis dri de mnams nas ngo mtshar du gyur rmad du gyur te /
translated: The brahmins, householders, and the Licchavi chieftain Vimalakīrti, the lord of the Licchavis, in the great city of Vaiśālī, having smelled the fragrance, were amazed and astonished.

original: lus dang / sems dang bar gyur nas li tsa b'i brgyad khri bzhi stong tshang ba dang lhan cig tu dri ma med par grags pa'i khyim du zhugs so //
analyzed: lus dang / sems dang bar gyur nas li tsa b'i brgyad khri bzhi stong tshang ba dang lhan cig tu dri ma med par grags pa'i khyim du zhugs so //
translated: and their bodies and minds became serene.

original: de dag gi khyim de na byang chub sems dpas gang pa'i seng ge'i khri de tsam du mtho ba de tsam du che zhing yangs pa la 'khod pa mthong ste /🔽mthong nas de dag shin tu mos shing rab tu dga' ba chen po skyes te /
analyzed: de dag gi khyim de na byang chub sems dpas gang pa'i seng ge'i khri de tsam du mtho ba de tsam du che zhing yangs pa la 'khod pa mthong ste / mthong nas de dag shin tu mos shing rab tu dga' ba chen po skyes te /
translated: They entered the house of Vimalakīrti together with the full company of eighty-four thousand Licchavis.

original: de dag thams cad kyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag la phyag btsal @349a *//
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag la phyag btsal @349a *//
translated: They saw the Licchavi Vimalakīrti sitting calmly on his bed, and they all prostrated themselves before him.

original: nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Having thus prostrated themselves, they sat to one side.

original: sa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyang dri des bskul nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa'i khyim du lhags so //
analyzed: sa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyang dri des bskul nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa'i khyim du lhags so //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire and of the realm of pure matter, also attracted by the fragrance, came to the house of Vimalakīrti.

original: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dang / nyan thos chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dang / nyan thos chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to the elder Śāriputra and the great disciples, “Reverends, the buddhafields are pure.🔽

original: btsun pa rnams /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal zas bdud rtsi thugs rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa zo la nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa la sems nye bar ma 'dogs shig /
analyzed: btsun pa rnams / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal zas bdud rtsi thugs rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa zo la nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa la sems nye bar ma 'dogs shig /
translated: Then, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to the venerable Śāriputra and the other great disciples, “Reverends,🔽eat the food of the Tathāgata,🔽which is imbued with the great compassion of the Tathāgata!

original: sbyin pa spyod ma nus sa re /🔽de na nyan thos kha cig 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sbyin pa spyod ma nus sa re / de na nyan thos kha cig 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: Do not be miserly with regard to the food!

original: zhal zas nyung du 'di la 'di lta bu'i 'khor 'dis ji ltar bza'o snyam mo //🔽de nas sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des nyan thos de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: zhal zas nyung du 'di la 'di lta bu'i 'khor 'dis ji ltar bza'o snyam mo // de nas sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des nyan thos de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: ” Some of the disciples thought, “How can so many people eat so little food?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /🔽khyed rang gi shes rab dang / bsod nams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab dang / bsod nams su ma snyoms shig /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / khyed rang gi shes rab dang / bsod nams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab dang / bsod nams su ma snyoms shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The bodhisattva who had been emanated by the supernatural power of the Buddha said to the disciples, “Reverends,🔽do not be disparaging about the food of the Tathāgata!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Do not compare the wisdom and the power of the Tathāgata with that of the disciples!

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po bzhi ni zad kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po bzhi ni zad kyang srid kyi /
translated: For example, it is possible that the four great oceans could dry up,

original: zhal zas 'di la zad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: zhal zas 'di la zad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: but this food will not be exhausted in the least.

original: sems can thams cad kyis zhal zas 'di kham ri rab tsam du bskal bar zos kyang 'di zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis zhal zas 'di kham ri rab tsam du bskal bar zos kyang 'di zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if all sentient beings were to eat from this food for an eon, with each mouthful being the size of Mount Meru, it still would not be exhausted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims dang / shes @349b rab dang / ting nge 'dzin mi zad pa las byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal zas kyi snod du lus pa 'di zad par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / shes @349b rab dang / ting nge 'dzin mi zad pa las byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal zas kyi snod du lus pa 'di zad par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is impossible to exhaust the food of the Tathāgata, which arises from the imperishability of morality, wisdom, and samādhi.

original: de nas zhal zas des 'khor thams cad la tshim par byas kyang zhal zas de zad par ma gyur to //
analyzed: de nas zhal zas des 'khor thams cad la tshim par byas kyang zhal zas de zad par ma gyur to //
translated: Then, although that food satisfied the entire assembly, that food was not exhausted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams dang / sems can gzhan dag gis zhal zas zos pa de dag kyang ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i bde pa lus las skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams dang / sems can gzhan dag gis zhal zas zos pa de dag kyang ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i bde pa lus las skyes so //
translated: The bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and other beings who ate the food experienced a happiness in their bodies like that of the bodhisattvas in the world system called Sarvasukhamaṇḍita.

original: de dag gi spu'i khung bu nas kyang 'di lta bu'i dri 'byung ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi spu'i khung bu nas kyang 'di lta bu'i dri 'byung ba ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: And from their pores there came the fragrance🔽of the perfume of the best of all the world systems.

original: dper na / 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog de na shing rnams las dri 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog de na shing rnams las dri 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It was like the fragrance of the trees in the world system called Sarva­gandha­sugandhā.

original: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa shes bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa shes bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces smras so // rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Then, knowing that the Licchavi Vimalakīrti was in the house, the bodhisattvas who had come from the buddhafield of the Tathāgata Gandhottama­kūṭa asked the Licchavi Vimalakīrti:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa de'i chos ston ba ci 'dra /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa de'i chos ston ba ci 'dra /
translated: “Son of good family, what is the Dharma like that you teach here in this house?”🔽They replied, “The Tathāgata does not teach the Dharma by means of letters,

original: de dag gis smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa de ni yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis chos mi ston te /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa de ni yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis chos mi ston te /
translated: but by means of the Dharma of the absence of letters.

original: dri de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dul bar gyur te /🔽spos kyi shing gang dang / gang gi drung du @350a *//
analyzed: dri de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dul bar gyur te / spos kyi shing gang dang / gang gi drung du @350a *//
translated: The bodhisattvas are disciplined by means of the fragrance of morality,🔽and the fragrance of tolerance, perseverance, meditative concentration, and wisdom.🔽“The bodhisattvas who sit under those trees

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'dug pa de dang / de dag las 'di 'dra ba'i dri byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'dug pa de dang / de dag las 'di 'dra ba'i dri byung ste /
translated: are disciplined by the fragrance of the Dharma.

original: gang dri de mnams ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dri de mnams ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as they smell it, they attain the samadhi called the source of all the bodhisattva’s qualities.🔽As soon as they attain that samadhi, all the bodhisattva’s qualities arise in them.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams skye'o; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams skye'o; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattvas said to the Licchavi Vimalakirti, “How should we honor the sick?

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa chos bstan pa ji lta bu rab tu ston par mdzad /
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa chos bstan pa ji lta bu rab tu ston par mdzad /
translated: What is the Dharma taught by the Lord Sakyamuni which they should hear in order to be cured of their sickness?”

original: smras pa / skyes bu dam pa rnams /
analyzed: smras pa / skyes bu dam pa rnams /
translated: Vimalakirti replied, “Good sons,

original: sems can 'di dag ni gdul dka' ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni gdul dka' ste /
translated: these living beings are difficult to cure.

original: sems can dmu rgod gdul dka' ba 'di rnams la dmu rgod dang / gdul dka' ba gdul ba'i gtam rnams rab tu ston to //🔽dmu rgod gdul dka' ba rnams gdul ba gang /
analyzed: sems can dmu rgod gdul dka' ba 'di rnams la dmu rgod dang / gdul dka' ba gdul ba'i gtam rnams rab tu ston to // dmu rgod gdul dka' ba rnams gdul ba gang /
translated: For these unruly living beings, who are difficult to cure, he teaches the Dharma of unruly and difficult-to-cure diseases.

original: dmu rgod gdul dka' ba'i gtam de gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmu rgod gdul dka' ba'i gtam de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cure for the unruly and difficult-to-cure diseases?🔽What is the Dharma of the unruly and difficult-to-cure diseases?”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o //🔽'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o // 'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas so //
translated: This is the hell realm.🔽This is the animal realm.

original: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten no //
translated: This is the realm of the Lord of Death.

original: 'di ni mi khom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi khom pa'o //
translated: This is the realm of no opportunity.

original: 'di ni dbang po nyams par skye ba'o //🔽'di ni lus kyi nyes par spod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po nyams par skye ba'o // 'di ni lus kyi nyes par spod pa'o //
translated: This is the realm of the impaired faculties.🔽This is the physical misdeed.

original: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of the physical misdeed.

original: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'o //

original: 'di ni ngag gis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par @350b smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par @350b smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of the verbal misdeed.

original: 'di ni yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'o //

original: 'di ni yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni srog gcod pa'o // 'di ni ma byin par len pa'o //
translated: This is killing.🔽This is stealing.

original: 'di ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o //🔽'di ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o // 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'o //

analyzed: 'di ni phra ma'o // 'di ni ngag rtsub pa'o //
translated: This is slander.🔽This is harsh speech.

original: 'di ni tshig kyal pa'o //🔽'di ni brnab sems so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig kyal pa'o // 'di ni brnab sems so //
translated: This is idle chatter.🔽This is covetousness.

original: 'di ni gnod sems so //
analyzed: 'di ni gnod sems so //
translated: This is malice.

original: 'di ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: This is wrong view.

original: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of that.

original: 'di ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser sna'o //
translated: This is stinginess.

original: 'di ni ser sna'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser sna'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of stinginess.

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so //🔽'di ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so // 'di ni khro ba'o //
translated: This is immorality.🔽This is anger.

original: 'di ni le lo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni le lo'o //
translated: This is laziness.

original: 'di ni le lo'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni le lo'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of laziness.

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu'o //

original: 'di ni bslab pa'i gzhi las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bslab pa'i gzhi las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is transgressing the basis of training.

original: 'di ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: This is the vow of individual liberation.

original: 'di ni bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bya pa'o //
translated: This is to be done.

original: 'di ni mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bya ba'o //
translated: This is not to be done.

original: 'di ni rnam par 'byor pa'o //🔽'di ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par 'byor pa'o // 'di ni spong ba'o //
translated: This is mastery.🔽This is abandonment.

original: 'di ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: This is obscuration.

original: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: This is non-obscuration.

original: 'di ni ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ltung ba'o //
translated: This is a downfall.

original: 'di ni ltung ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ltung ba las byung ba'o //
translated: This is emerging from a downfall.

original: 'di ni lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni lam mo //

original: 'di ni lam ngan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam ngan pa'o //
translated: This is a bad path.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //🔽'di ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o // 'di ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: This is virtue.🔽This is non-virtue.

original: 'di ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //

original: 'di ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'o; ;'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'o; ;'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is blameless. This is defiled.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //🔽'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o // 'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: This is undefiled.🔽This is mundane.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //

original: 'di ni 'dus byas so //🔽'di ni 'dus ma @351a *//
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas so // 'di ni 'dus ma @351a *//

original: byas so // 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: byas so // 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is uncompounded. This is afflicted.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: This is purified.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: This is cyclic existence.🔽This is nirvana.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes de lta bur chos rnam pa du mar bshad nas rta dmu rgod lta bu'i sems rab tu gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes de lta bur chos rnam pa du mar bshad nas rta dmu rgod lta bu'i sems rab tu gnas par byed do //
translated: Having explained the Dharma in this way, in many different ways, he tames the wild mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / rta'am /
analyzed: dper na / rta'am /
translated: For example,

original: bal glang dmu rgod gnad du brdab pa tshun chad kyis dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bal glang dmu rgod gnad du brdab pa tshun chad kyis dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a wild horse or elephant is tamed by striking it in its most sensitive spot.

original: de bzhin du sems can dmu rgod gdul dka' ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal thams cad smos pa'i gtam gyis dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dmu rgod gdul dka' ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal thams cad smos pa'i gtam gyis dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, wild and difficult to tame sentient beings are tamed by the story of the suffering of all.🔽Those bodhisattvas said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Excellent!

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi che ba bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi che ba bzhag ste /
