original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: khyod zhum pa'i sems ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod zhum pa'i sems ma skyed cig /
translated: do not give rise to a discouraged mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; kun dga' bo /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; kun dga' bo /
translated: Why is that? Ānanda,

original: khyod nyan thos rnams la dgongs te mang du thos pa'i mchog go zhes ngas bstan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i nang na ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod nyan thos rnams la dgongs te mang du thos pa'i mchog go zhes ngas bstan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i nang na ma yin no //
translated: I have taught that you are the most learned among the hearers, but not among the bodhisattvas.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽byang chub sems @357a *//
analyzed: kun dga' bo / byang chub sems @357a *//
translated: Ānanda,

original: dpa' lta zhog gi /
analyzed: dpa' lta zhog gi /
translated: forget about the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag ni mkhas pa dag gis tshod gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mkhas pa dag gis tshod gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not to be measured by the wise.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: rgya mtsho thams cad kyi gting ni tshod gzung bar nus kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab dang / ye shes dang / dran pa dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa'i gting ni tshod gzung mi nus so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho thams cad kyi gting ni tshod gzung bar nus kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab dang / ye shes dang / dran pa dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa'i gting ni tshod gzung mi nus so //
translated: the depths of all the oceans can be measured, but the depths of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom, knowledge, mindfulness, retention, and eloquence cannot be measured.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams la khyod btang snyoms su gyis shig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams la khyod btang snyoms su gyis shig /
translated: You should not be indifferent to the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa 'dis snga dro gcig la bkod pa bstan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul thob pa thams cad kyis bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du'ang rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par sprul pa'i cho 'phrul thams cad kyis ston mi nus so //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa 'dis snga dro gcig la bkod pa bstan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul thob pa thams cad kyis bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du'ang rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par sprul pa'i cho 'phrul thams cad kyis ston mi nus so // de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spos mchog brtsegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar te /
translated: in a single morning, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti has demonstrated more miraculous transformations than could be performed by all the bodhisattvas, disciples, and individual Buddhas of the ten directions, throughout a hundred thousand aeons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal zhing tshig 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal zhing tshig 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then all the bodhisattvas who had come from the buddhafield of the Tathāgata Gandhottama­kūṭa placed their palms together in reverence and, with their palms together, addressed the Tathāgata:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bdag cag gis 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di la ngan par 'du shes bskyed pa yid la bgyis pa rnams spang bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di la ngan par 'du shes bskyed pa yid la bgyis pa rnams spang bar 'tshal lo //
translated: We should abandon the idea that we have had of this buddha realm as being inferior.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul @357b dang / thabs mkhas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul @357b dang / thabs mkhas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: the buddha realms of the bhagavān buddhas and their skillful methods are inconceivable.

original: de dag sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyi ba'i slad du ji lta ji lta bur bzhed pa de ltar de lta bur zhing bkod pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyi ba'i slad du ji lta ji lta bur bzhed pa de ltar de lta bur zhing bkod pa ston to //
translated: In order to ripen beings, they display the array of realms in whatever way they wish.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog der mchis kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su dran par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rdzongs shig bdag cag la stsal bar gsol /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag cag 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi dri mchog der mchis kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su dran par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rdzongs shig bdag cag la stsal bar gsol / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: please give us a gift of the Dharma so that when we go to that world Sarva­gandha­sugandhā we will remember the Bhagavān.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Noble sons,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa zad pa pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa zad pa pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: “There is a bodhisattva liberation called ‘the exhaustion and non-exhaustion of conditioned things.’

original: de la khyed kyis bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de la khyed kyis bslab par bya ste /
translated: You should train in that.

original: de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas so //
translated: ‘Exhaustion’ means conditioned things.

original: mi zad pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: mi zad pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: ‘Non-exhaustion’ means unconditioned things.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi bya /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should not cause the exhaustion of conditioned things.

original: 'dus ma byas la'ang gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de la 'dus byas mi zad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la'ang gnas par mi bya'o // de la 'dus byas mi zad pa ni /
translated: They should not rest in unconditioned things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “The non-exhaustion of conditioned things is as follows:

original: byams pa chen po las ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po las ma nyams pa'o //
translated: It is not to diminish great love.

original: snying rje chen po ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ma btang ba'o //
translated: It is not to abandon great compassion.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par btsud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par btsud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems mi brjed pa'o //
translated: It is not to forget the mind of omniscience that is directed by superior intention.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: It is not to be discouraged in bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po mi gtong ba'o //
translated: It is not to abandon the means of attracting disciples.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir lus dang / srog 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir lus dang / srog 'dor ba'o //
translated: It is to give up one’s body and life for the sake of upholding the sublime Dharma.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: and not being satisfied with the roots of virtue.

original: yongs su bsngo bar mkhas pa la 'god @358a *//
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar mkhas pa la 'god @358a *//
translated: It is to be skilled in dedicating.

original: pa'o; ;chos tshol ba la le lo med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o; ;chos tshol ba la le lo med pa'o //
translated: It is to be indefatigable in seeking the Dharma.

original: chos bstan pa la slob dpon dpe mkhyud mi byed pa'o /
analyzed: chos bstan pa la slob dpon dpe mkhyud mi byed pa'o /
translated: It is to not be stingy with the Dharma when teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / mchod pa'i dngos po la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / mchod pa'i dngos po la brtson pa'o //
translated: It is to be diligent in seeing and making offerings to the Tathāgatas.

original: bsams bzhin du skye bas mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye bas mi skrag pa'o //
translated: It is not to be afraid of taking birth through the power of aspiration.

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dag la ma khengs mi 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dag la ma khengs mi 'dud pa'o //
translated: It is not to be arrogant in prosperity and not to be discouraged in misfortune.

original: ma bslabs pa rnams la mi brnyas shing lobs pa rnams la ston pa ltar phangs par sems pa'o //
analyzed: ma bslabs pa rnams la mi brnyas shing lobs pa rnams la ston pa ltar phangs par sems pa'o //
translated: It is to not despise those who are untrained and to think of those who are trained as dear as a teacher.

original: nyon mongs pa rgyas pa rnams la tshul bzhin nye bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rgyas pa rnams la tshul bzhin nye bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is to be properly engaged with those whose afflictions are rampant.

original: dben pa la dga' zhing de la ma chags pa'o; ;bdag gi bde la ma zhen cing pha rol bde ba la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa la dga' zhing de la ma chags pa'o; ;bdag gi bde la ma zhen cing pha rol bde ba la zhen pa'o //
translated: It is to delight in solitude and not to be attached to it. It is to not be attached to one’s own happiness and to be attached to the happiness of others.

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la mnar med pa ltar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la mnar med pa ltar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of the absorptions, concentrations, and attainments as being like the Avīci hell.

original: 'khor ba la skyed mos tshal dang / mya ngan las 'das pa lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la skyed mos tshal dang / mya ngan las 'das pa lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of cyclic existence as a garden, and of Nirvāṇa as a house.

original: slong ba rnams la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of beggars as spiritual teachers.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rdzogs par byed par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rdzogs par byed par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of giving away all possessions as completing the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la bskyab par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la bskyab par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of protecting those with faulty morality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ba mang 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ba mang 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of the perfections as a great caravan.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la bdag po g-yog tu 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la bdag po g-yog tu 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He has the idea of the factors of awakening as his servants.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad kyis chog mi shes shing sangs rgyas kyi @358b zhing thams cad kyi yon tan bdag gi zhing du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad kyis chog mi shes shing sangs rgyas kyi @358b zhing thams cad kyi yon tan bdag gi zhing du sgrub pa'o //
translated: He is not satisfied with any amount of the accumulation of wholesome actions, and he establishes the good qualities of all buddha-fields in his own field.

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po yongs su bkang ba'i phyir gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po yongs su bkang ba'i phyir gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: It is the giving of gifts without reserve in order to fill out the major and minor marks of a Buddha.

original: sdig pa thams cad mi byed pas lus dang / ngag dang / sems brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi byed pas lus dang / ngag dang / sems brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is the adornment of body, speech, and mind by not committing any evil.

original: lus dang / ngag yongs su dag cing sems yongs su dag pas bskal pa grangs med par 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag yongs su dag cing sems yongs su dag pas bskal pa grangs med par 'khor ba'o //
translated: It is the wandering in saṃsāra for countless eons with a pure body, speech, and mind.

original: sems dpa' bas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa thos kyang zhum par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' bas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa thos kyang zhum par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is not being discouraged by hearing of the immeasurably great qualities of the Buddha, because of one’s courage.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra tshar gcod par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi mtshon rnon po thogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra tshar gcod par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi mtshon rnon po thogs pa'o //
translated: It is taking up the sharp weapon of wisdom in order to destroy the enemy of the afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur ba'i phyir phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur ba'i phyir phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kun shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases in order to bear the burden of all sentient beings.

original: bdud kyi sde gzhom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde gzhom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus 'bar ba'o //
translated: It is the blazing of diligence in order to destroy the army of Māra.

original: nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ye shes tshol ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ye shes tshol ba'o //
translated: It is the seeking of wisdom without pride.

original: chos gzung ba'i phyir 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes pa'o //🔽'jig rten thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: chos gzung ba'i phyir 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes pa'o // 'jig rten thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: He has few desires and is content in order to receive the Dharma.🔽He is not mixed up with any worldly things in order to please all the world.

original: 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam thams cad las ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam thams cad las ma nyams pa'o //
translated: He does not fall away from any good conduct in order to conform with the world.

original: bya ba thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: He generates the superknowledges in order to demonstrate all activities.

original: thos pa thams cad gzung ba'i phyir gzungs dang / dran pa dang / ye shes so //
analyzed: thos pa thams cad gzung ba'i phyir gzungs dang / dran pa dang / ye shes so //
translated: He has the dhāraṇīs, mindfulness, and wisdom in order to retain all that he hears.

original: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pa'o //🔽chos bstan @359a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pa'o // chos bstan @359a *//
translated: He has the knowledge of the highest and the lowest faculties in order to cut through the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: He has unimpeded eloquence in order to teach the Dharma.

original: slobs pa thob pa rab tu rnyed pas spobs pa thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: slobs pa thob pa rab tu rnyed pas spobs pa thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: He has unimpeded eloquence in order to attain the highest teaching.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi la ma yongs su dag pas lha dang / mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi la ma yongs su dag pas lha dang / mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'o //
translated: By the purity of the path of the ten virtues, one experiences the excellence of gods and humans.

original: tshad med pa bzhi rab tu bskyed pas tshangs pa'i lam du 'god pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi rab tu bskyed pas tshangs pa'i lam du 'god pa'o //
translated: By the generation of the four immeasurables, one establishes them in the path of Brahmā.

original: chos bstan par gsol ba dang / rjes su yi rang zhing legs so zhes bya ba byin pas sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs rab tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan par gsol ba dang / rjes su yi rang zhing legs so zhes bya ba byin pas sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs rab tu thob pa'o //
translated: By requesting the teaching of the Dharma and giving approval with cries of “Excellent!” one attains the voice of the Buddha.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid sdom pas khyad par du 'gro ba dang / chos thams cad la ma chags pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam rab tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid sdom pas khyad par du 'gro ba dang / chos thams cad la ma chags pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam rab tu thob pa'o //
translated: By the restraint of body, speech, and mind, one progresses to excellence and, by being unattached to all phenomena, one attains the conduct of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun sdud pas theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun sdud pas theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
translated: By gathering the saṅgha of bodhisattvas, one introduces them to the Great Vehicle.

original: yon tan thams cad chud mi za bas bag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad chud mi za bas bag yod pa yin te /
translated: By not wasting any of one’s qualities, one is conscientious.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la brtson zhing byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la brtson zhing byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: in this way the bodhisattva strives for the Dharma and does not exhaust conditioned things.

original: ji ltar na 'dus ma byas la mi gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dus ma byas la mi gnas she na /
translated: How is it that they do not dwell in the unconditioned?

original: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid la byang bar byed cing stong pa nyid mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid la byang bar byed cing stong pa nyid mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
translated: When they are purifying emptiness, they do not actualize emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa la yongs su byang bar byed kyang mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la yongs su byang bar byed kyang mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
translated: When they are purifying the absence of marks, they do not actualize the absence of marks.

original: smon pa med pa la yongs su byang bar byed kyang smon pa med pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la yongs su byang bar byed kyang smon pa med pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
translated: When they are purifying the absence of wishes, they do not actualize the absence of wishes.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa la yongs su byang bar @359b byed kyang mngon par 'du mi byed pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa la yongs su byang bar @359b byed kyang mngon par 'du mi byed pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed /
translated: When they are purifying the absence of formations, they do not actualize the absence of formations.

original: mi rtag par so sor rtog kyang dag pa'i rtsa bas chog mi shes /
analyzed: mi rtag par so sor rtog kyang dag pa'i rtsa bas chog mi shes /
translated: They discern impermanence but are not satisfied with the roots of virtue.

original: sdug bsngal bar so sor rtog kyang bsams bzhin du skye bdag med par so sor rtog kyang bdag yongs su 'dor ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar so sor rtog kyang bsams bzhin du skye bdag med par so sor rtog kyang bdag yongs su 'dor ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They discern suffering but take birth intentionally. They discern selflessness but do not abandon the self.

original: zhi bar so sor rtog kyang shin tu zhi ba'ang mi skyed /
analyzed: zhi bar so sor rtog kyang shin tu zhi ba'ang mi skyed /
translated: They discern peace but do not give rise to complete peace.

original: dben par so sor rtog kyang lus dang / sems kyis kyang 'bad /
analyzed: dben par so sor rtog kyang lus dang / sems kyis kyang 'bad /
translated: They discern the absence of a self, but they do not abandon the body.

original: gnas med par so sor rtog kyang dkar po'i chos kyis gnas spong ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gnas med par so sor rtog kyang dkar po'i chos kyis gnas spong ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They discern the absence of a location, but they do not abandon the location of virtuous qualities.

original: 'byung ba med par so sor rtog kyang sems can rnams kyi khur blangs pa'ang thogs /
analyzed: 'byung ba med par so sor rtog kyang sems can rnams kyi khur blangs pa'ang thogs /
translated: They discern the absence of an origin, but they do not abandon the burden of sentient beings.

original: zag pa med par so sor rtog kyang 'khor ba'i rgyun la slong bar yang byed /
analyzed: zag pa med par so sor rtog kyang 'khor ba'i rgyun la slong bar yang byed /
translated: They discern the absence of defilement, but they do not abandon the continuity of saṃsāra.

original: rgyu ba med par so sor rtog kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rgyu bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu ba med par so sor rtog kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rgyu bar yang 'gyur /
translated: They discern the absence of movement, but they move in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: bdag med par so sor rtog kyang sems can la snying rje chen po mi 'dor /
analyzed: bdag med par so sor rtog kyang sems can la snying rje chen po mi 'dor /
translated: They discern the absence of a self, but they do not abandon great compassion for sentient beings.

original: mi skye bar so sor rtog kyang nyan thos kyi nges par yang mi ltung /
analyzed: mi skye bar so sor rtog kyang nyan thos kyi nges par yang mi ltung /
translated: They discern the absence of birth, but they do not fall into the certainty of the śrāvakas.

original: gsog dang / gso ba dang / snying po med pa dang; bdag po med pa dang / gnas med par so sor rtog kyang bsod nams gsog ma yin pa dang / ye shes gsob ma yin pa dang / brnag pa yongs su rdzogs shing rang byung ba'i ye shes su dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: gsog dang / gso ba dang / snying po med pa dang; bdag po med pa dang / gnas med par so sor rtog kyang bsod nams gsog ma yin pa dang / ye shes gsob ma yin pa dang / brnag pa yongs su rdzogs shing rang byung ba'i ye shes su dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: He is not accumulating merit, he is not accumulating wisdom, he is not fulfilling his vow, he is not being consecrated with self-arisen pristine consciousness,

original: rang byung gi ye shes la brtson pa dang / nges pa'i don sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes la brtson pa dang / nges pa'i don sangs rgyas kyi rigs la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: he is not striving for self-arisen pristine consciousness, and he is not abiding in the definitive meaning, the buddha family.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽de ltar na de lta bu'i chos @360a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / de ltar na de lta bu'i chos @360a *//
translated: Son of a good family!

original: la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dus ma byas la ma gnas shing 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dus ma byas la ma gnas shing 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed do //
translated: In that way, a bodhisattva who has devotion to such a Dharma does not abide in the unconditioned and does not cause the conditioned to be exhausted.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family!

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: Furthermore, a bodhisattva does not abide in the unconditioned in order to accomplish the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to accomplish the accumulation of wisdom, he does not destroy compounded things.

original: byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to be endowed with great love, he does not rest in the uncompounded.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to be endowed with great compassion, he does not destroy compounded things.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to ripen beings, he does not rest in the uncompounded.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to aspire to the qualities of the Buddha, he does not destroy compounded things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to perfect the marks of the Buddha, he does not rest in the uncompounded.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to perfect omniscient wisdom, he does not destroy compounded things.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to be skilled in means, he does not rest in the uncompounded.

original: shes rab kyis shin tu brtags pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis shin tu brtags pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to be well-investigated by wisdom, he does not destroy compounded things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not rest in the uncompounded, in order to purify the Buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make an end of compounded things, in order to be blessed by the Buddhas.

original: sems can gyi don myong ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don myong ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not rest in the uncompounded, in order to experience the weal of all beings.

original: chos kyi @360b don yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi @360b don yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make an end of compounded things, in order to demonstrate the weal of the Dharma.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not rest in the uncompounded, in order to gather the roots of goodness.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bag chags kyi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bag chags kyi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make an end of compounded things, in order to have the habit of the roots of goodness.

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not rest in the uncompounded, in order to fulfill their vows.

original: smon pa med pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make an end of compounded things, in order to be free from vows.

original: bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not rest in the uncompounded, in order to purify their intentions.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make an end of compounded things, in order to purify their superior intentions.

original: mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtsen pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtsen pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the uncompounded because they play with the five superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa drug gi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa drug gi phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not cause the compounded to cease because they have the six superknowledges of the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs yongs su bkang ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs yongs su bkang ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the uncompounded because they have fulfilled the accumulations of the perfections.

original: dus yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: dus yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not cause the compounded to cease because they have fulfilled the time.

original: chos kyi nor kun bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi nor kun bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the uncompounded because they have gathered together the wealth of the Dharma.

original: nyi tshe ba'i chos mi 'dod pas 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i chos mi 'dod pas 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not cause the compounded to cease because they do not desire the Dharma of the half-taught.

original: chos kyi sman kun sdud pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sman kun sdud pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the uncompounded because they have gathered together the medicine of the Dharma.

original: ci rigs par chos kyi sman sbyor ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: ci rigs par chos kyi sman sbyor ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: They do not cause the compounded to cease because they apply the medicine of the Dharma as is appropriate.

original: dam bcas pa la brtan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la brtan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the uncompounded because they are firm in their vows.

original: dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed de /🔽chos kyi rtsi @361a *//
analyzed: dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed de / chos kyi rtsi @361a *//
translated: In order to bring the commitment to completion, he does not exhaust conditioned things.

original: thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to accomplish the medicine of the Dharma, he does not abide in the unconditioned.

original: 'di ltar chos chung du'i sman sbyor ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos chung du'i sman sbyor ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi byed do //
translated: In order to prepare the medicine of the lesser Dharma, he does not exhaust conditioned things.

original: de nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mi gnas so //
translated: In order to know all the sicknesses of the afflictions, he does not abide in the unconditioned.

original: nad thams cad zhi ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: nad thams cad zhi ba'i phyir 'dus byas zad par mi 'dod do //
translated: In order to cure all sicknesses, he does not wish to exhaust conditioned things.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sons,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi byed cing 'dus ma byas la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas zad par mi byed cing 'dus ma byas la mi gnas te /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattvas do not exhaust conditioned things and do not abide in the unconditioned.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ liberation called ‘the Exhaustion and Non-exhaustion.🔽’

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: Noble sirs,

original: khyed kyis kyang de la brtson par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang de la brtson par gyis shig /
translated: you should also strive for it.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag bstan pa 'di thos nas tshim zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag bstan pa 'di thos nas tshim zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
translated: Then, having heard this teaching, those bodhisattvas were satisfied, delighted, and overjoyed.

original: rab tu dga' nas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' nas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: They were happy and joyful.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod ba bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mchod par bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di thams cad phye ma dang / spos dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod ba bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mchod par bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di thams cad phye ma dang / spos dang /
translated: In order to make offerings to the Bhagavān and to those bodhisattvas and to this Dharma teaching, they covered the entire trichiliocosm with powders, incense,

original: bdug pa mang po thams cad dang / me tog gis pus mo nub tsam du khebs par byas te /
analyzed: bdug pa mang po thams cad dang / me tog gis pus mo nub tsam du khebs par byas te /
translated: perfumes, and flowers up to their knees.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du'ang mngon par bkram pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du'ang mngon par bkram pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: They also spread them out in the Bhagavān’s circle of followers. They bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet,

original: bcom ldan @361b 'das la lan gsum bskor nas ched du brjod pa brjod cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan @361b 'das la lan gsum bskor nas ched du brjod pa brjod cing /
translated: circumambulated him three times, and uttered this meaningful expression:

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: “Bhagavān, we will now go to our own buddha realm.”

original: skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi mchog der 'khod do //
analyzed: skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi mchog der 'khod do //
translated: in the twinkling of an eye, in a moment, in a second, he arrived in the universe Sarva-gandha-sudha.

original: zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rdzongs kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o ////
analyzed: zad pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rdzongs kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the tenth chapter, on the Dharma-gift called “The Inexhaustible Treasury.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the Licchavi Vimalakirti,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: khyod gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa la lta 'dod par gyur ba de'i tshe khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la ji ltar lta /
analyzed: khyod gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa la lta 'dod par gyur ba de'i tshe khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la ji ltar lta /
translated: when you wish to see the Tathagata, how do you view him?”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Thus addressed, the Licchavi Vimalakirti said to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gang gi tshe bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la lta 'tshal ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong bas lta ba lags so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la lta 'tshal ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong bas lta ba lags so //
translated: when I wish to see the Tathagata, I view him by not seeing any Tathdgata.”

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas ma skyes pa dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'gro ba dang / da ltar gyi dus la'ang mi gnas par lta lags so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas ma skyes pa dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'gro ba dang / da ltar gyi dus la'ang mi gnas par lta lags so //
translated: It is seen as not arising from the past, not going to the future, and not remaining in the present.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the suchness of form is

original: gzugs ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis pa'o //
translated: not form.

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the suchness of feeling is

original: tshor ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: not feeling.

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the suchness of perception is

original: 'du shes ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ma mchis pa'o //
translated: not perception.

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the suchness of formation is

original: 'du byed ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ma mchis pa'o //
translated: not formation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi @362a *//🔽rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi @362a *// rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the suchness of consciousness is

original: rnam par shes pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: not consciousness.

original: khams bzhi ni mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: khams bzhi ni mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The four elements do not remain;

original: nam mkha'i khams dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: they are similar to the element of space.

original: skye mched drug ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The six sense sources are unborn;

original: mig gi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: mig gi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: they are beyond the path of the eye,

original: rna ba'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: rna ba'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: beyond the path of the ear,🔽beyond the path of the nose,🔽beyond the path of the tongue,🔽beyond the path of the body,🔽and beyond the path of the mind.

original: sna'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: sna'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the path of the nose.

original: lce'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: lce'i lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the path of the tongue.

original: lus kyi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: lus kyi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the path of the body.

original: yid kyi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: yid kyi lam las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the path of the mind.

original: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: It is unmixed with the three realms.

original: dri ma gsum dang bral ba /
analyzed: dri ma gsum dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from the three stains.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum gyi rjes su mchis pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum gyi rjes su mchis pa /
translated: It is in accord with the three gateways to liberation.

original: rig pa gsum thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa gsum thob pa /
translated: It is the attainment of the three knowledges.

original: ma thob pa yang dag par thob pa /🔽chos thams cad la ma chags pa'i mthar phyin pa /
analyzed: ma thob pa yang dag par thob pa / chos thams cad la ma chags pa'i mthar phyin pa /
translated: It is the attainment of what has not been attained.🔽It is the perfection of nonattachment to all phenomena.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' ma mchis pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' ma mchis pa /
translated: It is the absence of the limit of reality.

original: de bzhin nyid la rab tu gnas pa de phan tshun du bral ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la rab tu gnas pa de phan tshun du bral ba /
translated: It is the abiding in suchness. It is free from mutual separation.

original: rgyus ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: rgyus ma bskyed pa /
translated: It is not produced by causes.

original: rkyen la rag ma las pa /🔽mtshan nyid ma mchis pa /
analyzed: rkyen la rag ma las pa / mtshan nyid ma mchis pa /
translated: It is not dependent on conditions.🔽It is without characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not endowed with characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'ang ma lags pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'ang ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a single characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'ang ma lags pa /🔽rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'ang ma lags pa / rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa /
translated: It is not different characteristics.🔽It is not conceptual.

original: kun tu rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa /
analyzed: kun tu rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa /
translated: It is not fully conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa /🔽pha rol na'ang ma lags pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par gyur pa'ang ma lags pa / pha rol na'ang ma lags pa /

translated: It is amazing that this holy man has come from a buddhafield that is so pure and delights in a buddhafield that has the faults of many imperfections.

analyzed: de nas li tsa b'i dri ma med par grags pas smras pa /
translated: Then, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: med par grags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

translated: and finally the Tathāgata named Kāśyapa will appear.

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi rgyal @373b po de'i dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba rgyal bu zla gdugs zhes bya ba de gzhan yin pa snyam du 'dzin na khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi rgyal @373b po de'i dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba rgyal bu zla gdugs zhes bya ba de gzhan yin pa snyam du 'dzin na khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: if you think that the one who upheld the true Dharma of the Blessed Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha at that time, on that occasion, was someone else, you should not regard it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods,

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu zla gdugs zhes bya bar gyur te /
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu zla gdugs zhes bya bar gyur te /
translated: at that time, on that occasion, I was the prince named Candracchattra.

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods,

original: rnam grangs 'dis kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: by this method you should understand it in this way.

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods,

original: ji tsam na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa'i nang na chos kyi mchod pa ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa'i nang na chos kyi mchod pa ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: to the extent that among all offerings to the Tathāgatas, the offering of the Dharma is said to be supreme.

original: mchog dang / dam pa dang / mchog rab dang / gya nom pa dang / bla ma dang / bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog dang / dam pa dang / mchog rab dang / gya nom pa dang / bla ma dang / bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the highest, the most excellent, the most sublime, the most refined, the unsurpassed, and the unequaled.

original: lha'i dbang po; de lta bas na nga la zang zing gis ma mchod par chos kyi mchod pas mchod cig /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po; de lta bas na nga la zang zing gis ma mchod par chos kyi mchod pas mchod cig /
translated: O Lord of Gods, therefore, do not worship me with material offerings, but worship me with the offering of the Dharma.

original: nga la zang zing gis bsti stang ma byed /
analyzed: nga la zang zing gis bsti stang ma byed /
translated: Do not honor me with material things,

original: chos kyi bsti stang gis ri mor gyis shig /
analyzed: chos kyi bsti stang gis ri mor gyis shig /
translated: but honor me with the honor of the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya:

original: byams pa / ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bskal pa bye ba grangs med par yang dag par bsgrubs pa 'di khyod la gtad do //
analyzed: byams pa / ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bskal pa bye ba grangs med par yang dag par bsgrubs pa 'di khyod la gtad do //
translated: Maitreya, I entrust to you this unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening that I have accomplished over countless millions of eons.

original: ci nas phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yongs su bzung bas dzambu'i gling du rgyas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ci nas phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yongs su bzung bas dzambu'i gling du rgyas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By the power of your blessing, in the future, in the future time, may this kind of Dharma discourse spread throughout the world,

original: ma nub par gyis shig /
analyzed: ma nub par gyis shig /
translated: and may it not disappear.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byams pa / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu pho'am /
analyzed: byams pa / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu pho'am /
translated: Maitreya, in the future there will be sons of good family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo dang / lha dang / @374a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dang / lha dang / @374a *//
translated: daughters of good family, gods,

original: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras who have planted roots of virtue,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa de dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ma thos pas nyams par gyur ta re /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa de dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ma thos pas nyams par gyur ta re /
translated: who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. I fear that they will decline because they have not heard this Dharma teaching.

original: 'di lta bu'i mdo sde thos nas shin tu dga' zhing dad ba rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / spyi bos len par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i mdo sde thos nas shin tu dga' zhing dad ba rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / spyi bos len par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect those sons of good family and daughters of good family who, having heard such a sūtra as this, will find great joy and faith and will take it to their heads,

original: byams pa / khyod kyis de'i dus na mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di rgyas bar gyis shig /
analyzed: byams pa / khyod kyis de'i dus na mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di rgyas bar gyis shig /
translated: Maitreya, you should spread such a sūtra as this at that time.

original: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: Maitreya, there are two seals of bodhisattvas.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: tshig dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs la dad pa'i phyag rgya dang / chos kyi tshul zab mos mi skrag cing /
analyzed: tshig dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs la dad pa'i phyag rgya dang / chos kyi tshul zab mos mi skrag cing /
translated: the seal of faith in the various words and syllables, and the absence of fear due to the profound way of the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: the seal of faith in various words and phrases, and the seal of engaging in the very mode of reality just as it is.

original: byams pa / de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Maitreya, those two are the bodhisattvas’ seals.

original: byams pa / de la byang chub sems dpa' gang dag tshig dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs la dad cing lhur len pa de dag ni las dang po pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / de la byang chub sems dpa' gang dag tshig dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs la dad cing lhur len pa de dag ni las dang po pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, those bodhisattvas who have faith in and are intent on various words and phrases are beginners.

original: tshangs par spyad nas ring po ma lon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad nas ring po ma lon par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that they have not been practicing pure conduct for long.

original: byams pa / gang dag mdo sde zab mo ma gos pa phrugs pa dang / snrel zhi'i rgyud kyi tshig dang / rim pa rab tu dbye ba 'di 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dag ni ring du tshangs par @374b spyod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / gang dag mdo sde zab mo ma gos pa phrugs pa dang / snrel zhi'i rgyud kyi tshig dang / rim pa rab tu dbye ba 'di 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dag ni ring du tshangs par @374b spyod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that those bodhisattvas who recite, listen to, believe in, and teach this profound discourse that is unadulterated, that has a continuous sequence of words, and that has a division into topics have been practicing pure conduct for a long time.

original: byams pa / de la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu gnyis kyis bdag la rma 'byin te /
analyzed: byams pa / de la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu gnyis kyis bdag la rma 'byin te /
translated: Maitreya, a beginner bodhisattva wounds himself with two causes.

original: chos zab mo la nges par sems par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos zab mo la nges par sems par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not think about the profound Dharma.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: sngon ma thos pa'i mdo sde zab mo thos na skrag cing the tshom du gyur nas rjes su yi rangs par mi byed cing /
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa'i mdo sde zab mo thos na skrag cing the tshom du gyur nas rjes su yi rangs par mi byed cing /
translated: When he hears a profound sūtra that he has not heard before, he is frightened and doubtful. He does not rejoice.

original: 'di lta bur bdag cag gis sngon ma thos na de gang nas 'ongs zhes spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta bur bdag cag gis sngon ma thos na de gang nas 'ongs zhes spong bar byed do //
translated: He rejects it, saying, “We have never heard this before. Where did this come from?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang dag mdo sde zab mo 'dzin pa dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa dang / chos zab mo ston pa de dag la mi sten /🔽mi 'grogs / bsnyen bkur mi byed cing /
analyzed: gang dag mdo sde zab mo 'dzin pa dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa dang / chos zab mo ston pa de dag la mi sten / mi 'grogs / bsnyen bkur mi byed cing /
translated: he does not attend on those who hold the profound sūtras, who are vessels for the profound Dharma, and who teach the profound Dharma.🔽He does not associate with them or honor them.

original: de dag la bsti stang mi byed par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la bsti stang mi byed par gyur te /
translated: He does not respect them.

original: bar bar du de dag la mi snyan par yang brjod do //
analyzed: bar bar du de dag la mi snyan par yang brjod do //
translated: He even says uncomplimentary things about them.

original: rgyu de gnyis kyis las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te chos zab mo la nges par mi rtog pa'o //🔽rgyu gnyis kyis zab mo la mi mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyis las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te chos zab mo la nges par mi rtog pa'o // rgyu gnyis kyis zab mo la mi mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
translated: These two causes cause the beginner bodhisattvas to wound themselves and not to gain certainty about the profound Dharma.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos la'ang bzod pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos la'ang bzod pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There are two other causes that cause the bodhisattvas who do not have faith in the profound to wound themselves and not to gain acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /🔽las dang po pa spyad nas ring po ma lon pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la brnyas shing khyad du gsod pa de 'dzin du mi 'jug /🔽mi 'byed / mi ston pa dang / gang zab mo la shin tu ma dad pas bslab pa la ri mo mi byed cing 'jig rten gyi zang zing sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs @375a *//
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na / las dang po pa spyad nas ring po ma lon pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la brnyas shing khyad du gsod pa de 'dzin du mi 'jug / mi 'byed / mi ston pa dang / gang zab mo la shin tu ma dad pas bslab pa la ri mo mi byed cing 'jig rten gyi zang zing sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs @375a *//
translated: What are these two?

original: shing chos kyi sbyin pas ma yin te /
analyzed: shing chos kyi sbyin pas ma yin te /
translated: They are (1) despising and disparaging the beginner bodhisattvas who have not been practicing for long and not causing them to take up, explain, or teach the Dharma and (2) not respecting the training because of having very little faith in the profound and benefiting sentient beings with material gifts of the world and not with the gift of the Dharma.

original: byams pa / zab mo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rgyu 'di gnyis kyis bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
analyzed: byams pa / zab mo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rgyu 'di gnyis kyis bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
translated: Maitreya, the bodhisattva who is devoted to the profound, wounds himself with these two things.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'ang myur du thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'ang myur du thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not quickly attain patience with unborn things.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said this, the bodhisattva Maitreya said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du legs par gsungs pa ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du legs par gsungs pa ni / bcom ldan 'das / ngo mtshar to //
translated: “Lord, what the Lord has said is good.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord, it is wonderful.

original: legs so / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: legs so / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord, it is excellent.

original: bdag gis da slan chad nongs pa 'di dag spang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis da slan chad nongs pa 'di dag spang bar bgyi'o //
translated: Lord, from now on we will avoid these faults.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs ma mchis pa nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa 'di bsrung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs ma mchis pa nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa 'di bsrung bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will protect this unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment which the Tathagata has accomplished during countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of thousands of eons.

original: gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will uphold it.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rigs kyi bu pho dang / rigs kyi bu mo snod du gyur pa de dag la mdo sde 'di lta bu lag tu son par bgyi'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rigs kyi bu pho dang / rigs kyi bu mo snod du gyur pa de dag la mdo sde 'di lta bu lag tu son par bgyi'o //
translated: I will place in the hands of those future sons and daughters of good family who are worthy vessels this kind of discourse.

original: dran pa gang gis 'di 'dra ba'i mdo sde 'di lta bu la mos pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / 'dzud pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang; gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dran pa nye bar bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dran pa gang gis 'di 'dra ba'i mdo sde 'di lta bu la mos pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / 'dzud pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang; gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dran pa nye bar bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: I will establish the mindfulness by which they will be inspired by this kind of discourse, and will retain it, hold it, master it, promulgate it, write it down, and explain it extensively to others.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis de dag brtan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de dag brtan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will make them firm.

original: bcom ldan 'das @375b de'i dus na 'di lta bu'i mdo sde 'di la mos pa dang / rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @375b de'i dus na 'di lta bu'i mdo sde 'di la mos pa dang / rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: Blessed One, at that time, those who are inspired by this kind of discourse and who engage with it

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i byin gyis rlabs lags par rig bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i byin gyis rlabs lags par rig bar bgyi'o //
translated: one should know that they are blessed by the bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin nas legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin nas legs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Maitreya, “Excellent!

original: legs so // byams pa /
analyzed: legs so // byams pa /
translated: Excellent, Maitreya!

original: khyod kyi tshig de ni legs par smras te /
analyzed: khyod kyi tshig de ni legs par smras te /
translated: Your words are well spoken.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang khyod kyis legs par smras pa de la rjes su yi rang ba gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang khyod kyis legs par smras pa de la rjes su yi rang ba gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata approves of your well-spoken words.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis dbyangs gcig tu tshig 'di skad ces smras so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis dbyangs gcig tu tshig 'di skad ces smras so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then those bodhisattvas spoke in one voice, saying these words: “Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing so so nas mchis te /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing so so nas mchis te /
translated: we too, after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa, will come from our own buddha realms

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'di rgyas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'di rgyas par bgyi'o //
translated: and we will spread the buddha’s enlightenment of the Tathāgata.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag kyang mos par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag kyang mos par bgyi'o //
translated: We will inspire those sons of a good family.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the four mahārājas said to the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gang dang / gang na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu spyod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de dang / de dag tu bcom ldan 'das bdag cag rgyal po bzhi'ang dpung dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gang dang / gang na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu spyod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de dang / de dag tu bcom ldan 'das bdag cag rgyal po bzhi'ang dpung dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Wherever this kind of Dharma discourse is practiced, taught, and explained, there, in those villages, towns, cities, countries, and royal palaces, we four kings, along with our armies,

original: bzhon pa dang bcas pa 'khor dang bcas te /
analyzed: bzhon pa dang bcas pa 'khor dang bcas te /
translated: vehicles, and retinues,

original: der chos nyan pa'i slad @376a *//
analyzed: der chos nyan pa'i slad @376a *//
translated: will come to listen to the Dharma.

original: du mchi'o // chos smra ba de'i dpag tshad khor yug tu ci nas kyang chos smra ba de la glags lta ba dang / klan ka tshol ba gang gis kyang glags mi rnyed bar bsrung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: du mchi'o // chos smra ba de'i dpag tshad khor yug tu ci nas kyang chos smra ba de la glags lta ba dang / klan ka tshol ba gang gis kyang glags mi rnyed bar bsrung bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will protect the Dharma teacher within a league all around, so that no one who seeks to find fault or looks for an opportunity to harm the Dharma teacher will be able to do so.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di zungs shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di zungs shig /
translated: you should uphold this Dharma discourse.

original: chongs shig / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher yang dag par ston cig /
analyzed: chongs shig / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher yang dag par ston cig /
translated: Keep it and teach it extensively to others.

original: gsol pa / bdag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bzung ba lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bdag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bzung ba lags na /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, I have received this Dharma discourse.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
